📢Calling all middle & high school students in MA-01! 

My office is now accepting submissions for the 2025 Congressional App Challenge! The deadline to apply is Thursday, October 30.

For more information visit: 
https://t.co/WeVhxAlK1z https://t.co/RV6w4X48jv

Wishing the Jewish community in the First District and around the world a happy Rosh Hashanah! May the new year bring peace and prosperity to you and your loved ones.

Shanah Tovah! https://t.co/jyw5suD2xF

Republicans had no problem extending tax cuts for the billionaire class earlier this year.

Now, they have a choice: lower costs and protect the healthcare of millions of Americans, or shut down the government.

For @HouseDemocrats, the choice is clear. We will always stand up and defend the healthcare of American families.

For more than a decade, the Miracle League of Western Massachusetts has provided young people with disabilities a platform to play our nation's beloved pastime.

On Sunday, I had the privilege of throwing out the first pitch and meeting with the volunteers who make it all possible. It was a terrific day to celebrate an inspiring organization. Play ball!

I am pleased that the Irish and British governments have agreed on a comprehensive framework that charts a constructive path forward to address the legacy of violence during the Troubles.

Just as cooperation and good faith negotiation brought an end to the Troubles through the Good Friday Agreement, these principles will guide us as we work to address the issues surrounding the legacy of the past.

My full statement ⤵️
https://t.co/BJNzeUUQOj

Trump’s attempts to politicize the Fed were always wrong and self-dealing.

Today’s rate cut is an example of why it’s important for the Fed to make decisions that are economically responsible—not politically convenient.
In the Trump Administration, if you don't bend the knee to pseudoscience, you get the axe.

If you get sick, have a baby, or need to care for someone you love, you should be able to take time off without fear of losing your paycheck.

My Democratic colleagues and I are fighting to make that a reality for every worker.

The latest on that fight:

If a government agency has put the privacy of millions of Americans at risk, it owes the people answers.

That’s why we’re introducing a Resolution of Inquiry to get to the bottom of the mess DOGE has made at SSA.

Last night, I voted against the NDAA. House Republicans have taken what has historically been bipartisan legislation and turned it into a political weapon to promote a culture war.

I'm proud that MA-01 is home to two military bases. The men and women at Barnes and Westover, and their families, make immense sacrifices every single day. That's why I'm deeply committed to ensuring the NDAA reflects our nation’s values and security priorities.

Simply put, they deserve better.

My full statement ⤵️
https://t.co/dG27daHtqQ

While 24 years have passed since the terrorist attacks of 9/11, the memories of that day, and the ones that followed, have not diminished.

We are forever indebted to the first responders for their immense sacrifice. September 11, 2001, is a day that forever changed our nation's history, but it's their strength and resolve that defined the final chapter.

May we always hold close the memories of all those who lost their lives 24 years ago today.

I’m horrified to learn that Charlie Kirk has passed away. I’m keeping his family and loved ones, along with the Utah Valley community, in my thoughts and prayers.

We cannot let this kind of violence become normalized. There is absolutely no place for it in any facet of American life. Those who commit such heinous acts need to be brought to justice.

Political violence is a cancer on our society and has absolutely no place in America or our political system. My thoughts are with Charlie Kirk and his family, and I hope that everyone on the Utah Valley campus is safe.

Much of western Massachusetts is under a severe thunderstorm warning and a tornado warning. Please stay safe and seek shelter in the lowest-level, interior room.

For more safety tips, visit: https://t.co/jpqwZiv3Tq

The difference nine months can make.
 
These aren't "rigged" or "phony" numbers. These are the facts. The fact is, when you invest in the American worker and the middle-class, you create good-paying jobs. When you invest in the billionaire class and pursue a reckless tariff policy, hiring freezes, jobless claims rise, and prices skyrocket.
 
When will the pain be enough for our Republican colleagues to break their silence?

States should not have to protect themselves from conspiracy theories.

I’m grateful to @MassGovernor Healey for putting the safety of the people of Massachusetts over politics. RFK Jr.'s pseudoscience has no place at the top of what should be the world's model health system.

Survivors and the American people deserve the full truth. But last night’s heavily redacted files—97% of which we’ve seen before—fall well short.

That is why I signed the discharge petition to force a House vote on legislation to release the Epstein files.

After years of advocacy by families of Holyoke Veterans’ Home residents, we’re one step closer to delivering the new facility our veterans deserve.

I'm proud that the federal funding we secured will ensure world-class care for our nation's heroes.

https://t.co/oEvsh0uHwg

The President's assault on science will have lasting repercussions for our nation.

Freezing $1.4 billion in NIH grants only serves to harm America's innovative edge, while China and other global competitors are doubling their efforts on scientific research.

For Massachusetts, the epicenter of American medical research, the effects of these funding cuts will be profound. For patients, this is a matter of life and death.

The American work ethic shaped this country, and we are a better nation for it.

Whether it be  fighting to protect pensions, Social Security, or the right to unionize, I am proud to stand with the American worker today and every day. https://t.co/47QHW18swm

To our students in western Mass and across the Commonwealth, welcome back to school! The future is dependent on your vision and ambition—we're rooting for you every step of the way.

Thank you to the dedicated teachers and staff who show up every day to inspire, challenge, and support our students.

The Trump Administration is putting conspiracy theories and quackery before science. This war they are waging to burn our public health system to the ground puts you and your loved ones in danger.

Americans deserve leaders who defend science, not dismantle it.

My heart goes out to the Minneapolis community affected by the horrific tragedy that took place at Annunciation Church.

Our schools and churches should be safe, and action is long overdue.

Enough is enough.

167 days—that's how many days have passed since @WaysMeansCmte Democrats called for oversight and accountability during a markup.

We've known it all along, and now, the truth comes out.

Privacy is next to liberty, and yet our Republican colleagues remain silent as the Trump Administration recklessly makes vulnerable the personal data of over 300 million Americans.

This is the last thing parents should have to worry about. A 7.3% increase in the cost of school items from last year is nearly three times the inflation rate. Rather than focusing on lowering costs for American families, President Trump continues to sow chaos with reckless tariff policies.

At the same time, his Big Ugly Law finances massive tax breaks for the wealthy at the expense of Medicaid and SNAP—programs that determine whether children qualify for free or cost-reduced school meals.

What's the President's solution? Buy fewer pencils.

President Trump is unleashing economic assault. With his illegal firing of Federal Reserve Governor Dr. Lisa Cook, he is threatening the financial security of every American.

Politicizing the central bank threatens Americans with more inflation, higher rates, unstable retirement accounts, and more uncertainty.

I'm proud that the Bipartisan Infrastructure Law I helped shape has delivered more than $145M for West-East Rail.

This project will stimulate economic growth and deliver on the promise of regional equity. We're full steam ahead!

https://t.co/bL2n2stxrs

Social Security is a promise America made that no senior would be left to face old age alone. That promise for 90 years has been expanded so that none of the nation’s most vulnerable is left behind.

Republicans want to break that promise. But Democrats will ensure we keep it. https://t.co/rpmUDS6hQX

90 years ago, from the dais of the Ways and Means Committee to the stroke of FDR’s pen, the promise of Social Security was born.

Since then, it has protected seniors after a lifetime of work, given families a source of stability in their darkest hours, and offered peace of mind to millions.

My full statement:

https://t.co/fYsKIUW7uJ

Safety is paramount; we all want safe communities, but that is not what this is about.

The Trump administration is looking for a distraction from their harmful economic agenda, one that takes healthcare away from millions of families & increases costs for everyday Americans.

Free and fair elections are the bedrock of our democratic system, providing an equal voice for every American, no matter their race, gender, or zip code.

As we commemorate the 60th anniversary of the Voting Rights Act, we are reminded now more than ever just how important it is to continue the fight to ensure equal access to the ballot box.

Texas Democrats are standing up to an unconscionable attack on the bedrock of our democratic system: free and fair elections.

My full statement on the gerrymandered congressional map proposed by the Texas State Legislature ⤵️ https://t.co/OuGrMQvMFN

First the Fed, now the Bureau of Labor Statistics. Trump would rather cook the books than clean up the mess he's made. 

But no amount of manipulation will hide what Americans are feeling: higher prices and a tough job market.

The American people didn’t ask for this. 

Hiring has stalled, prices are surging, and this administration is actively undermining the labor market Democrats rebuilt. 

This goes beyond failed Republican leadership, it's actively making life harder for people.

For nearly 30 years, Danny has been a force for good-- fighting for kids, uplifting families, and championing those too often overlooked.

His leadership, heart, and lifelong commitment to dignity and equity leave a lasting legacy. 

Sending my best wishes to my friend and his family.

And we know that there isn’t a backdoor they won’t try to make Wall Street’s dream a reality.

60 years ago today, Medicare and Medicaid became law.

Since then, these programs have made health care a reality for hundreds of millions, helping people live with dignity, security, and hope.

Democrats have never stopped fighting to keep this promise – and we never will. https://t.co/D3lisx0Y9J

Ahead of tomorrow’s 60th anniversary of Medicaid and Medicare, it was a privilege to be at the Life Care Center of Wilbraham, emphasizing the importance of these programs and what’s at stake with the Republican agenda.

Medicaid and Medicare are essential promises to the people – ones we must sustain and expand, not cut.

https://t.co/wKuYbsP1lU

$3.4 TRILLION and millions kicked from their health care.

The American people do not deserve this cruelty.

A coffee and a paper in print, just as nature intended. 

MA-01 still gets it

Republicans are reversing our progress, and now, Americans in the ACA marketplace could see 75% increases in their premiums next year.

Dangerous heat is expected to return to Massachusetts this week. Make sure you are protecting yourself by:

🏡Limiting time outdoors

Don’t let the dog days of summer catch you off guard! ☀️

Republicans did nothing but break promises in their ugly law:

❌ No tax on tips? Still taxed, only temporary and limited deductions.

❌ No tax on overtime? Still taxed, only partial and temporary deductions.

❌ No tax on Social Security? Not even close.

Republicans want you distracted by their spin, but they can’t escape the substance.

Democrats invested billions to assert ourselves as the leaders of the 21st century energy revolution and not cede ground to our global competitors.

https://t.co/D4cYx1BlsJ

So great seeing you all!

Nobody is asking for bigger bills and higher costs.

Heartbreaking news out of Fall River.

My heart is with the loved ones of the 9 lives lost, countless injured, and the community that now grieves this unimaginable tragedy.

Thank you to the fire crews, first responders, and everyone working to respond to this terrible moment.

Wishing everyone a safe and happy Independence Day! On the eve of our nation’s 250th anniversary, let us all take a moment to remember and thank those who have fought and continue to fight for our nation. It is because of them that we may enjoy the freedoms upon which our nation was founded – life, liberty, and the pursuit of happiness.

Republicans just voted to kick 17 million Americans off their health care and cut SNAP benefits for the 42 million Americans depending on SNAP to put food on the table - all in the name of a tax cut for the billionaire class.

They turned their backs on the American people, and @HouseDemocrats will make sure everyone knows it.

Leader @RepJeffries has been holding the floor for over 8 hours because he—and every single Democrat—knows just how disastrous this bill is for the American people.

No matter what happens today, Democrats and I won’t stop fighting for a brighter future for every American. https://t.co/KhNDOXpWhm

It's a privilege to yield the floor to the distinguished Minority Leader, a leader who understands the gravity of the situation and what it means for everyday Americans.

He knows that this is a moral moment and that a budget is more than just about numbers - it's about what you believe in and who you fight for.

And he is still leading the fight.

Republicans think they can pull the wool over the eyes of the American people by jamming through their health care cuts and tax cuts for billionaires in the middle of the night. 

Not on my watch. 

Tune in now as I lead the debate on the House Floor: https://t.co/RtbMaFrrxZ

I'm standing up for the 330,000+ people in MA-01 who rely on Medicaid to receive health care.

I'm standing up for the 224,000+ people in MA-01 who rely on SNAP to receive nutritious food.

I'm standing up for the 11,000+ students in MA-01 who rely on Pell grants to make college more affordable.

The Republicans are trying to bankroll another billionaire tax cut on the backs of children, seniors, veterans, and working families.

We can defeat the Big, Ugly Bill. We just need four Republicans to do the right thing and stand with the American people by voting no.

OTD in 1964, President Lyndon B. Johnson signed the Civil Rights Act into law, prohibiting discrimination based on race, color, sex, religion, or national origin, and desegregating public facilities and schools.

Today, as we celebrate the 61st anniversary of one of our nation's greatest legislative achievements, we reflect on the progress we've made and recommit ourselves to advancing equal opportunity and civil rights for all.

The House GOP bill was already a disaster for families and workers. The Senate just passed something even worse. House Republicans will now get a second chance to either protect 17 million people’s health care or hand bags of cash to the rich on their backs.

It shouldn’t be a hard choice.
My full statement: https://t.co/I9y9gT9ZSM

Dwight Evans has dedicated over 45 years of public service fighting for fairer and safer communities — carrying Philly’s spirit and resilience in everything he does.

His advocacy and moral compass have made Congress, Pennsylvania, and the nation stronger.

Wishing my friend and his family all the best ahead.

Today, we celebrate ten years since Obergefell v. Hodges, the landmark decision that codified marriage equality in the United States and affirmed the right of every American to love freely and without limitation.

The federal government should never stand in the way of Americans' right to marry whomever they choose. As a proud cosponsor of the Equality Act, we must continue fighting until every American can live and love with the respect and dignity they deserve.

Today marks three years since the Supreme Court struck down nearly 50 years of precedent set by Roe v. Wade.

While a woman’s right to choose remains sacred in Massachusetts, millions of women across the country are not as fortunate.

As we continue standing up to the GOP’s attack on our nation’s health care, I remain committed to defending women’s health. We will not stop fighting until every American enjoys the same protections and the same access to vital health care resources as women in Massachusetts.

Tonight, President Trump offered the American people no strategy and no justification for his attack on Iran — only the prospect of another war that the American people do not want. That’s why Congress, as the voice of the people, is entrusted with the constitutional authority to decide matters of war.

I pray for the safety of our troops and the American lives that have been put in harm’s way in the region.

Congress must return to Washington to assert its authority and prevent any further unchecked escalation. The only path to peace in the region is one where we exhaust every avenue of diplomacy.

Delighted to participate in the Juneteenth celebration at Springfield City Hall as we commemorate the 160th anniversary of Juneteenth.

Today, we honor and remember those who fought for life, liberty, and the pursuit of happiness for all. https://t.co/Ms9Ywn8CTb

Democrats are committed to defending and strengthening Social Security and Medicare for every worker, every retiree, and every generation to come.

My statement on today’s Social Security and Medicare Trustees Reports: https://t.co/TwkPVLAVJc

Social Security and Medicare are essential commitments to the American people.

The Trump Administration’s current assault on the Social Security Administration is not a glitch or a misstep — it’s a feature of the Republican playbook and is a backdoor benefit cut.

Medicaid, or what we in Massachusetts call MassHealth, plays a critical role in our communities:

⚕️ More than 2 million residents rely on Medicaid for health coverage
💰 Medicaid brings in $13 billion each year – half of all federal funding for Massachusetts
🧑‍⚕️ Medicaid directly supports 125,000 health care jobs
🏥 Medicaid provides one-fifth of revenue for hospitals and half the revenue for nursing facilities and community health centers

In my district, EVERY hospital has a public payer mix that accounts for more than two-thirds of revenue. 

Whether a hospital closes or has to make significant cuts, the proposed Medicaid cuts under the GOP tax scam will have devastating consequences for patients, health care workers, and entire communities.

The Constitution gives Congress — not the president — the power of the purse, and for good reason: members of Congress understand the needs of their district and how federal dollars can best help the communities they represent.

Over the past few days, I've celebrated two great examples of how congressionally directed spending makes a difference: the construction of a new fire station in Southbridge and the restoration of the historic Walker Grandstand at Forest Park in Springfield — investments that strengthen public safety and enhance urban living by improving our green spaces.

Today, I want to wish our friends in Ireland and James Joyce fans around the world a happy "Bloomsday." 

Over the course of seven years, Joyce penned the simple yet humanly encounters of protagonist Leopold Bloom, a story that resonates in the hearts of readers everywhere. 

More than a century later, “Ulysses” remains one of the finest literary masterpieces of our time.

Any father will tell you that “dad” is the best title you can ever hold. Being a father and grandfather is truly the greatest joy in life.

On this Father’s Day, we thank the fathers and father-figures who love unconditionally and stand by us through triumph and trial.

Happy Father’s Day to my fellow dads!

On this day in 1777, a resolution of the Second Continental Congress officially adopted the American flag.

Although our flag has had many iterations over the last 248 years, what it stands for has remained the same - hope, freedom, opportunity, and democracy.

We must always fight to protect these sacred values.

I am horrified by the heinous attack in Minnesota that took the lives of Representative Melissa Hortman and her husband, Mark, and injuring Senator John Hoffman and his wife, Yvette.

Political violence has no place in America. We must demand better and stand united against this type of hate in all of its forms.

My thoughts and prayers are with the Hortman and Hoffman families, their loved ones, and the people of Minnesota.

Today, as thousands of Americans gather to call for accountability and a renewed commitment to our democratic values, we are reminded of how our nation founded.

This year marks the 250th anniversary of Lexington and Concord, and for those of us in Massachusetts, we take great pride in the Commonwealth’s role in the founding of our nation; a nation that was founded and a government that is based upon one central idea - we should not be subjected to the whims of a king.

Our government is not a government of one person. It is a government by the people and for the people, and that is evident in the rights guaranteed by our Constitution.

There is no place for kings in America - not in 1775, and certainly not in 2025.

Shameful.

Assaulting a U.S. Senator for asking questions of an administration? For fulfilling his duty of overseeing the executive and asking questions on behalf of his constituents?

This is not America.

Every year, I look forward to welcoming the winner of the Congressional Art Competition to D.C. This year, I had the pleasure of hosting Kaia Couture from Belchertown High School, whose piece "Tangible Dream" will hang in the Capitol for the next year.

We often celebrate athletic achievements amongst our students, but just as important are their achievements in the arts. Congratulations to Kaia and her family!

To learn more about the Congressional Art Competition, visit https://t.co/ZCf718mb9c

My grandparents were immigrants. All they asked for was a fair shake and an opportunity - exactly what thousands of dreamers are asking for.

For 13 years, #DACA has transformed lives and communities throughout the country, allowing thousands of Dreamers to work hard, raise families, and contribute to our economy, our culture, and our future.

Today, as a proud cosponsor of the bipartisan Dream and Promise Act, I join millions of Americans in calling for a path to citizenship for Dreamers.

Nothing is off the table for Republicans when it comes to delivering another tax cut for billionaires.

❌ 16 million Americans will lose their health care
❌ 17 million children will be denied the full value of the Republicans' Child Tax Credit
❌ $300B will be cut from SNAP

And for what? To give the top 0.1% an extra $700 per day, while those making less than $50,000 get less than $1 per day.

The rich right now in America do not need a tax cut. 

Republicans and I could agree on a lot more things if they agreed people making under $400,000 should get a tax relief, not those making over $400,000.

For 60 years, Job Corps has been instrumental in training millions of young Americans to enter the labor force with the tools they need to secure reliable, good-paying jobs.

In Chicopee, Westover Job Corps employs more than 170 staff members and is actively training over 350 young people in a host of careers, including manufacturing, healthcare, and construction.

That is why I joined my colleagues in the MA Delegation in writing to Labor Secretary Chavez-DeRemer, demanding that the Trump administration reverse its decision to cancel federal Job Corps funding.

A manufacturer like Sublime Systems supports dozens of good paying jobs and spurs economic development in communities that need it the most, all while supporting advancements in clean energy.

Unfortunately, the Trump Administration is more focused on financing their billionare tax cut, and the American people continue to pay the price.

The Supreme Court just greenlit DOGE’s unfettered access to Social Security Data—jeopardizing the privacy of millions of Americans.

This isn’t about efficiency or rooting out fraud; it’s about dismantling safeguards, targeting our most vulnerable, and auctioning off the data to the highest bidder.

May’s job numbers confirm that the warning signs are here: A once-booming economy and labor force are buckling under President Trump’s chaos.

There is no one else to blame but the President and the Republicans in Congress enabling him.

No doctor’s appointments.
No prescriptions.
No treatments.
No surgeries.
No options when an emergency happens.
That’s what gutting health care means.
And that’s what will happen to 16 million people thanks to Republicans’ cruelty.

Republicans are lashing out at the nonpartisan @USCBO because they don’t like the truth being told about their bill.

https://t.co/1grfT9RLVP
Republicans are not only turning their backs on working families, they’re turning their backs on our kids too.

The hate-fueled, antisemitic attack on a peaceful demonstration in Boulder is sickening. We must condemn this hatred, stand with our Jewish neighbors, and work to stop the spread of antisemitic violence in America.

Today marks the 158th Memorial Day celebration. Originally called Decoration Day, the last Monday in May is a time for all Americans to remember and honor the brave men and women who made the ultimate sacrifice in service to our nation.

While spending time with your family and loved ones today, take a moment to reflect on the sacrifices made by the men and women in our armed services who have made this celebration possible.

Today, we lost one of the greats. 

Chairman Charlie Rangel was a historic leader and legislative titan who helped pave the way for the ACA, giving millions health care. 

On this Memorial Day, we honor his service in Korea & lifelong fight for justice. 

A great chairman — and an even better man. RIP, my friend.

The "big, beautiful bill" is so beautiful that House Republicans chose to debate it at 4 a.m. to avoid public scrutiny.

Why? Because they don't want you to know that they just voted to take health care away from nearly 14 million Americans and cut food assistance for families - all to finance a tax cut for billionaires. 

My full statement ⤵️

I am horrified by the senseless act of violence that took place outside the Capital Jewish Museum, taking the lives of two Israeli embassy staff.

This type of hate can never be justified and cannot be tolerated. Antisemitism has no place in our country.

My thoughts and prayers are with the victims, their loved ones, and all those impacted by this horrific tragedy.

This is not a Democrat chart.

This is not a Republican chart.

This is a chart from the nonpartisan @USCBO, and they are telling us the truth about the President's big, beautiful tax cut for billionaires.

People in the bottom 10% will see a 4% decrease in household wealth, while those in the top 10% will see a 2% increase.

Simply put, the rich get richer while the poor get poorer.

This is no way to govern.

At 1a.m., under the cover of darkness, Republicans convened the Rules Committee as they try to jam through the President's big, beautiful tax cut for billionaires.

They don't want the American people to know that they are cutting Medicaid and food assistance, while adding $5.3 trillion to the debt, all to give billionaires a $384B tax break.

I’m heartbroken to learn of the passing of my dear friend and colleague, Gerry. This is a profound loss. Virginia—and our entire country—has lost a great man, a passionate advocate, and a tireless fighter.
 
My thoughts and prayers are with his family, loved ones, and all who had the privilege of knowing him.

President Biden has brought strength and faith to all of life’s battles, and this diagnosis will be no different. I’m keeping him, Dr. Biden, and their entire family in my heart and prayers right now.

This tax bill isn't just about the numbers; it's about the people it will impact.

I'm thinking about my constituents at Riverside Industries in Easthampton and Life Care Center of Wilbraham who are among the 242k Medicaid recipients in MA-01 at risk of losing their health care. https://t.co/kWukJ9elGL

Republicans are doubling down on the same failed playbook. One that rigs the system for billionaires and big corporations, while everyone else pays the price.

Today's markup is about priorities, and it is clear where priorities lie for our Republican colleagues.

This bill provides yet another tax cut to the wealthiest among us, this time by taking away health care from nearly 14 million Americans.

My @HouseDemocrats colleagues and I are standing up and calling them out for what this bill really does - make life harder for the American people to line the pockets of billionaires.

The fabric of any family is a mother, and as someone who was raised by a grandmother and an aunt, I know that mothers come in all forms.

To everyone who bears that title, thank you for always caring and uplifting us. I hope your day was filled with love, surrounded by those who cherish you the most.

I was truly taken aback by the caliber of young men and women who attended my annual Academy Day at the @SpfldMuseums. Every year, students from across the First District attend Academy Day to learn more about the military academies and the application process.

We also honored four students whom I nominated to one of the academies and will begin their studies this summer. Needless to say, our nation is in good hands with the next generation of leaders.

If you or someone you know is interested in attending one of the service academies, please visit https://t.co/iLW1QvoA1O for more information.

A budget is more than just numbers; it's a statement of our nation's values.

What does it say about our values when we're cutting critical programs while simultaneously pursuing a tax cut for the wealthiest Americans?

The American people deserve a budget that puts their needs first. This is just an appetizer of the cruelty ahead.

Harvard has done nothing wrong. 

By revoking Harvard’s tax-exempt status, President Trump is weaponizing the power of our government to attack any institutions that stand up for the rule of law. 

It’s unconstitutional, it’s illegal, and reeks of weakness.

Springfield College is where James Naismith infamously played the first game of basketball with nothing but a peach basket, and the Larry O’Brien trophy is named in honor of the Springfield native who transformed the NBA during his time as Commissioner.

World Basketball Day is a reminder that sports unite us, and basketball has always had the ability to bring together communities from across the globe.

Thanks to the Bipartisan Infrastructure Law, more than $550 million has been awarded to provide clean and safe water and improve water infrastructure throughout the Commonwealth.

In western Mass, we are making great strides to improve and expand affordable, accessible housing.

On Monday, we celebrated the redevelopment of yet another historic building - Ludlow Mill - into mixed-income apartments. This project benefitted from nearly $20 million in federal tax credits, including historic and low income housing credits - both of which I have championed in the @WaysMeansCmte.

Covering nearly half of this $43.2 million project, it is a stark reminder of the prominent role these tax credits will play in addressing our housing needs here in Massachusetts and throughout the nation.

On this Veterans Day, we thank our servicemembers and their families for sacrifices they have made to protect our freedoms and promote our values abroad.

Let us recommit ourselves to the promise we made when they entered the service: you protect us, and we’ll take care of you. For our veterans in western Massachusetts, that means fulfilling our promise to build a new Holyoke Veterans Home - one that is fit to serve our nation’s heroes.

Four years ago, we gathered outside the Holyoke Soldiers Home after 76 veterans tragically lost their lives. At that time, we promised to deliver change with a home that our veteran community deserved. Yesterday, we took a significant step forward in making that promise reality.

I am proud to have secured $264 million in federal funding to support this project and am grateful to VA Secretary Denis McDonough, with whom I was in frequent communication to ensure this funding was allocated for a new Holyoke Veterans Home.

It was a great day for western Massachusetts, especially for the family members of Holyoke Veterans Home residents. It was their advocacy that helped bring this home to fruition.

Today marks one year since Hamas committed a senseless and horrific act of violence that took the lives of more than 1,200 innocent civilians, including 40 Americans. 

Israel has a right to defend itself, and the United States continues to stand with Israel and support them in their efforts to protect their citizens. Ensuring their security and safety from any terrorist elements who threaten their existence is crucial not only for their national security, but global stability.

We will continue working with our allies on a path toward peace. This includes a negotiated, bilateral ceasefire that will release the hostages and put an end to this cycle of violence that has plagued the region for far too long. Only then will we be able to achieve the security that the Israeli and Palestinian people deserve.

Delighted to be in Lee this morning to announce a $1 million earmark for their Combined Public Safety Complex.

Congress has the fundamental responsibility to oversee the expenditure of the public purse, and investing in emergency services to ensure the safety of our constituencies is certainly a worthwhile investment.

I strongly condemn the missile attack launched by Iran earlier today. As President Biden and Vice President Harris continue making progress on establishing a negotiated ceasefire that would end this conflict and release the hostages, Iran launched more than 200 missiles, putting millions of innocent civilians at risk and the prospects of a peace deal in jeopardy.

Israel has a right to defend itself, and I am grateful for President Biden’s leadership in defeating this attack. I would urge all parties to continue working on a process toward peace to avoid a larger regional conflict and ensure the safety of innocent civilians.
